text: The Cartographic Journal is an academic journal about cartography published by Taylor & Francis on behalf of the British Cartographic Society, in affiliation with the International Cartographic Association. Its coverage includes "technologies of remote sensing, geographical information systems and global positioning systems". Its editor-in-chief is Alexander Ken; its 2018 impact factor is 1.276. ==References== Category:Taylor & Francis academic journals Category:Academic journals associated with learned and professional societies of the United Kingdom Category:Geography journals Category:Earth and atmospheric sciences journals Category:Remote sensing journals Category:Cartography
title: The Cartographic Journal
